item.description:
Take the Ferry to Boston's Harbor Islands!

 

Ride the T to the Ferry Terminal.

Enjoy the scenic boat rides with views of the city and the harbor.

Explore two islands ~ Hike the trails ~ Visit an historic fort ~ Enjoy the views! Eat and drink at a Boston pub on our return!

 

 

 

Spectacle Island has five miles of trails with breathtaking views of Boston, the harbor, and the sea.


Georges Island has an historic fort and visitor's center in addition to trails and views.

 

Boston has lots of pubs. We will choose one or two (or three)!!

 



MEET 10:15 AM at Boston’s Best Cruises Ticket Kiosk at LONG WHARF NORTH.

Roundtrip tickets: $15

(Note: Aquarium Whale Watch boats leave from Central Wharf-left of the Aquarium. Do not go there!)

 

And, Back in Boston, we'll head to a pub for drinks and dinner.  (What else did you expect?!) More on this later!

Getting There - The easiest & least expensive route is to carpool to the T station and ride the train from there.

*Don't worry if you've never ridden the T. It's easy & we'll be together!

Portsmouth Carpool: 8:15am @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. There are two parking lots. Meet in the back of the overflow lot - the lot farthest from the main bus terminal building, farther up Grafton Ave. Meet at the back of the lot.

Newburyport Carpool:  8:30 AM. C&J Bus lot, 90 Storey Ave/Rt 113 at I-95.

(Or take the 8:45am or earlier train N'port to North Station - 1hr. Then, Orange Line to State St. & Blue Line to Aquarium - 30mins.)

Park at Wonderland T Station in Revere - $5. Take MBTA Blue Line to Aquarium Station - $1.70. Follow the exit signs for the New England Aquarium. Upon exiting the station onto Atlantic Ave. turn around and walk toward the waterfront. (20mins: T & walk time)

Walk through the Long Wharf Marriott Hotel. When you exit the hotel, turn right to kiosk.

MEET 10 AM at Boston’s Best Cruises Ticket Kiosk at LONG WHARF NORTH.

Roundtrip tickets: $15

This is the first day that Boston Harbor National Park is open for the season. Did you even know that Boston had a National Park?

Note: Harbor Island boats leave from Long Wharf-North.

Ferry Schedule (Buy your ticket 20mins ahead. Boats do not wait!)

10:30 am Ferry arrive Georges 11am. Arrives Spectacle 11:30

Last ferry of day departs Spectacle 4:40.

Last ferry of day departs Georges 5:30.

Be on board at least 15 mins ahead of departure times!

 

Liability Release ~ AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Unless otherwise specified, refunds for timely cancellations will be processed the day after the event.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.how_to_find_us: If you don't see us sooner, meet in the bow of the ship! (That's the front!)
item.name: EXPLORE Boston Harbor Islands National Park!
